revised_title: Establishing the New Standards of Weights and Measures in the United Kingdom
tldr: Captain Henry Kater provides an account of the construction and adjustment of the new standards of weights and measures in the United Kingdom, based on the length of a pendulum vibrating seconds in London. He compares his findings with those of French scientist M. Biot and discusses the accuracy of the methods used in determining the length of the pendulum and the French metre.
